frame.name: Clothing
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame refers to clothing and its characteristics, including anything that people conventionally wear. The <fen>Wearer</fen> wears a <fen>Garment</fen> that has a certain <fen>Style</fen>, is made of a certain <fen>Material</fen>, and can be otherwise characterized by a <fen>Descriptor</fen>. In some cases, the <fen>Body_location</fen> (where the garment is worn) and <fen>Subregion</fen> of the clothing may also be specified.
<ex>Claudia dressed in a <fex name="Descriptor">dark</fex> <fex name="Descriptor">green</fex> <fex name="Material">cotton</fex> <t>DRESS</t> clasped round her slender waist with a broad yellow belt , drank a cup of coffee and opened her neglected post .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Garment
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifes the clothing worn.
<ex>Mike wore a new leather <fex name="Garment">jacket</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Wearer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Wearer</fen> is the person wearing the clothes, or for whom the clothes are intended.
<ex><fex name="Wearer">Mike</fex> wore a new leather jacket.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Style
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifes the design, or cut, of the clothing.
<ex>Mike wore a <fex name="Style">tailored</fex> leather <t>jacket</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifes the material from which the clothing is made.
<ex>Mike wore a new <fex name="Material">leather</fex> jacket.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifes any description of the clothing besides <fen>Style</fen> and <fen>Material</fen>. <ex>Mike wore a <fex name="Descriptor">new</fex> <fex name="Descriptor">black</fex> leather <t>jacket</t>.</ex> Note that each modifer of the target gets its own FE (and, hence, its own GF and PT).</def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies a part of the clothing.
<ex>Mike wore a leather jacket <fex name="Subregion">with fringes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifes the <fen>Use</fen> for which a <fen>Garment</fen> is worn or was made.
<ex>Mike wore a new <fex name="Use">riding</fex> jacket.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Body_location
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Body_location</fen> identifies the place on the body where the clothing is worn.
<ex>Hannah draped a shawl elegantly <fex name="Body_loc">over her shoulders</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual who created the <fen>Garment</fen>.
<ex>She 's wearing a <fex name="cre">Ralph Lauren</fex> <t>dress</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_creation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the <fen>Creator</fen> makes the <fen>Garment</fen>.
<ex>The <t>bikinis</t> <fex name="tim">of the 1940's</fex> are fairly similar.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition:
<def-root>The name given to a specific <fen>Garment</fen>. Note this is not the name of a general class of clothing items, but rather an individual item. This is accordingly VERY RARE.
<ex></ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: dress.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a one-piece garment for a woman or a girl that covers the body and extends down over the legs.

lexUnit.name: frock.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's or girl's dress

lexUnit.name: petticoat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's light, loose undergarment in the form of a skirt or dress.

lexUnit.name: ballgown.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a long dress, worn for the formal occasion of a ball

lexUnit.name: culottes.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: women's knee-length trousers, cut with very full legs to resemble a skirt.

lexUnit.name: chemise.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's loose-fitting undergarment or nightdress.

lexUnit.name: jodhpurs.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: trousers worn for horse riding that are close-fitting below the knee and have reinforced patches on the inside of the leg.

lexUnit.name: sock.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a knitted garment for the foot and lower part of the leg.

lexUnit.name: stocking.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's garment that fits closely over the foot and leg, typically made of fine knitted nylon yarn, held up by suspenders or an elasticated strip at the upper thigh.

lexUnit.name: leggings.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: protective overgarments for the legs

lexUnit.name: tunic.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a short, coat-like garment reaching

lexUnit.name: slip.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loose-fitting garment, especially a short petticoat.

lexUnit.name: gown.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long dress worn on formal occasions.

lexUnit.name: skirt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's outer garment fastened around the waist and hanging down around the legs.

lexUnit.name: shorts.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: short trousers that reach only to the knees or thighs.

lexUnit.name: pants.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: article of clothing worn at the waist, covering the buttocks and legs

lexUnit.name: trousers.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an outer garment covering the body from the waist to the ankles, with a separate part for each leg.

lexUnit.name: wrap.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loose outer garment or piece of material. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: shirt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a. a garment for the upper body, typically with a collar and sleeves and buttons down the front

lexUnit.name: blouse.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's upper garment resembling a shirt

lexUnit.name: cloak.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an overgarment that hangs loosely from the shoulders over the arms to the knees or ankles.

lexUnit.name: cape.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sleeveless cloak, especially a short one.

lexUnit.name: coat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a full-length outer garment with sleeves

lexUnit.name: greatcoat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long heavy overcoat.

lexUnit.name: overcoat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long warm coat.

lexUnit.name: jacket.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an outer garment extending to the waist or hips, with sleeves and a fastening down the front. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: vest.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a sleeveless garment worn on the upper part of the body

lexUnit.name: tie.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a strip of material worn around the neck beneath a collar, tied in a knot at the front. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: hose.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: stockings, socks, and tights

lexUnit.name: hosiery.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: stockings, socks, and tights collectively

lexUnit.name: clothing.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun clothes collectively.

lexUnit.name: clothes.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: items worn to cover the body.

lexUnit.name: finery.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: ostentatious clothes or decoration.

lexUnit.name: suit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a. a set of outer clothes made of the same fabric and designed to be worn together, typically consisting of a jacket and trousers or a jacket and skirt

lexUnit.name: necktie.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: another term for tie

lexUnit.name: neckwear.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun items worn around the neck, such as collars or ties, collectively.

lexUnit.name: cummerbund.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sash worn around the waist, especially as part of a man's formal evening suit.

lexUnit.name: scarf.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: pl. scarves or scarfs a length or square of fabric worn around the neck or head.

lexUnit.name: shawl.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a piece of fabric worn by women over the shoulders or head or wrapped round a baby.

lexUnit.name: bow-tie.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a necktie in the form of a bow.

lexUnit.name: pantyhose.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: women's thin nylon tights.

lexUnit.name: garter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a band worn around the leg to keep up a stocking or sock

lexUnit.name: panties.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: informal legless underpants worn by women and girls; knickers.

lexUnit.name: knickers.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's or girl's undergarment, covering the body from the waist or hips to the top of the thighs and having two holes for the legs.

lexUnit.name: sweater.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a pullover with long sleeves. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: jumper.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: Brit. a pullover or sweater

lexUnit.name: cardigan.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a knitted jumper fastening with buttons down the front.

lexUnit.name: pullover.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a knitted garment put on over the head and covering the top half of the body.

lexUnit.name: blazer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a jacket not forming part of a suit

lexUnit.name: kilt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a knee-length skirt of pleated tartan cloth, traditionally worn by men as part of Scottish Highland dress and also worn by women and girls. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: swimsuit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's one-piece swimming costume.

lexUnit.name: bikini.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a women's two-piece swimsuit [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: robe.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long, loose outer garment reaching to the ankles

lexUnit.name: bathrobe.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a dressing gown, especially one made of towelling. (Cdn query)

lexUnit.name: apron.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a protective garment covering the front of one's clothes and tied at the back. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: miniskirt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a very short skirt.

lexUnit.name: fishnet.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a fabric with an open mesh resembling a fishing net (modifier) or stockings made out of such a material.

lexUnit.name: legwarmers.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a pair of tubular knitted garments covering the legs from ankle to knee or thigh. (listed as leg warmers)

lexUnit.name: regalia.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the distinctive clothing and trappings of high office, worn at formal occasions.

lexUnit.name: raiment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun archaic &or. poetic/literary clothing.

lexUnit.name: apparel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: formal clothing

lexUnit.name: attire.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun clothes, especially fine or formal ones

lexUnit.name: vestment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a robe worn by the clergy

lexUnit.name: livery.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a special uniform worn by a servant, an official, or a member of a City Company. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: outfit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a set of clothes worn together.

lexUnit.name: garment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an item of clothing

lexUnit.name: undergarment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an article of underclothing.

lexUnit.name: underclothing.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: clothing worn under others next to the skin.

lexUnit.name: underclothes.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: clothes worn under others next to the s

lexUnit.name: underwear.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun clothing worn under other clothes next to the skin.

lexUnit.name: togs.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: informal for clothing

lexUnit.name: undies.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: informal articles of underwear.

lexUnit.name: shift.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a straight unwaisted dress.

lexUnit.name: pinafore.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a collarless, sleeveless dress worn over a blouse or jumper

lexUnit.name: mitten.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a glove with two sections, one for the thumb and the other for all four fingers. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: mitt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a mitten, or a glove leaving the fingers and thumb-tip exposed; also baseball mitt-a large fingerless glove worn by the catcher or first baseman

lexUnit.name: glove.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a covering for the hand having separate parts for each finger and the thumb. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: bodice.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's sleeveless undergarment, often laced at the front. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: corset.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: tightly fitting undergarment extending from below the chest to the hips, worn to shape the figure. or support a weak or injured back.

lexUnit.name: parka.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large windproof hooded jacket for use in cold weather.

lexUnit.name: windbreaker.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: US trademark a windcheater. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: windcheater.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: chiefly Brit. a wind-resistant jacket with a close-fitting neck, waistband, and cuffs. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: raincoat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long coat made from waterproofed or water-resistant fabric.

lexUnit.name: pyjama.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (as pyjamas) a suit of loose trousers and jacket for sleeping in

lexUnit.name: nightie.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: informal a nightdress.

lexUnit.name: nightdress.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a light, loose garment worn by a woman or girl in bed.

lexUnit.name: nightgown.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a nightdress.

lexUnit.name: nightwear.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun clothing worn in bed.

lexUnit.name: lingerie.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun women's underwear and nightclothes.

lexUnit.name: camisole.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's loose-fitting undergarment for the upper body.

lexUnit.name: waistcoat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: Brit. a close-fitting waist-length garment with no sleeves or collar and buttoning down the front, worn typically by men over a shirt and under a jacket. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: jeans.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: hard-wearing trousers made of denim or other cotton fabric.

lexUnit.name: overall.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: (also overalls) a loose-fitting coat or pair of dungarees worn over ordinary clothes for protection

lexUnit.name: coverall.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: also coveralls a full-length protective outer garment, typically with a zip at the front.

lexUnit.name: garb.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: clothing or dress, especially of a distinctive or special kind

lexUnit.name: smock.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a loose blouse or dress-like garment whose the upper part is gathered in smocking

lexUnit.name: sundress.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a light, loose sleeveless dress, typically having a wide neckline and thin shoulder straps.

lexUnit.name: bra.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's undergarment worn to support the breasts.

lexUnit.name: brassiere.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: full form of bra.

lexUnit.name: teddy.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A piece of lingerie resembling a leotard or a bathing suit in cut.

lexUnit.name: tights.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a close-fitting garment made of a knitted yarn, covering the legs, hips and bottom.

lexUnit.name: jumpsuit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a garment incorporating trousers and a sleeved top in one piece

lexUnit.name: kimono.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long, loose robe having wide sleeves and tied with a sash, originally worn as a formal garment in Japan.

lexUnit.name: kaftan.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a long, loosely fitted, tunic-like dress, worn by either men or women

lexUnit.name: uniform.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the distinctive clothing worn by members of the same organization or body or by children attending certain schools.

lexUnit.name: costume.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a set of clothes in a style typical of a particular time or place, often worn for a special occasion, such as a party or performance

lexUnit.name: motley.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun historical the particoloured costume of a jester.

lexUnit.name: get-up.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: informal a style or arrangement of dress, especially an elabora

lexUnit.name: ensemble.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: usu. in sing. a set of clothes worn together.

lexUnit.name: surplice.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loose white linen vestment worn over a cassock by clergy and choristers at Christian church services.

lexUnit.name: galosh.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a waterproof rubber overshoe.

lexUnit.name: welly.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: short for wellington.

lexUnit.name: wellington.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: ly Brit. a knee-length waterproof rubber or plastic boot.

lexUnit.name: slipper.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a comfortable slip-on shoe, usuall worn indoors

lexUnit.name: sandal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a light shoe with an openwork upper or straps attaching the sole to the foot.

lexUnit.name: sneaker.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mer. a soft shoe worn for sports or casual occasions.

lexUnit.name: stiletto.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a women's shoe with a thin, high, tapering heel.

lexUnit.name: boot.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sturdy item of footwear covering the foot and ankle, and sometimes the lower leg.

lexUnit.name: shoe.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a covering for the foot having a sturdy sole and not reaching above the ankle.

lexUnit.name: gumboot.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: chiefly Brit. a long rubber boot; a wellington

lexUnit.name: clog.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a shoe with a thick wooden sole.

lexUnit.name: footwear.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: shoes, boots, and other coverings for the feet

lexUnit.name: sari.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: pl. saris or sarees a garment consisting of a length of cotton or silk elaborately draped around the body, traditionally worn by women from the Indian subcontinent.

lexUnit.name: sarong.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a garment consisting of a long piece of cloth wrapped round the body and tucked at the waist or under the armpits, traditionally worn in SE Asia and now also by Western women.

lexUnit.name: poncho.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: pl. -os a garment of a type originally worn in South America, made of a thick piece of woollen cloth with a slit in the middle for the head.

lexUnit.name: abaya.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a full-length, sleeveless outer garment worn by Arabs.

lexUnit.name: jerkin.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sleeveless jacket

lexUnit.name: crinoline.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: historical a stiffened or hooped petticoat worn to make a long skirt stand out. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: muff.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a short tube made of fur or other warm material into which the hands are placed for warmth.

lexUnit.name: cowl.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a cloak with wide sleeves

lexUnit.name: tutu.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a female ballet dancer's costume consisting of a bodice and an attached skirt incorporating numerous layers of fabric, this being either short and stiff and projecting horizontally from the waist (the classical tutu) or long, soft, and bell-shaped (the romantic tutu).

lexUnit.name: t-shirt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a short-sleeved casual top, having the shape of a T when spread out flat.

lexUnit.name: polo-neck.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: Brit. a high, close-fitting, turned-over collar on a sweater. (listed as polo neck)

lexUnit.name: g-string.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a skimpy undergarment covering the genitals, consisting of a narrow strip of cloth attached to a waistband.

lexUnit.name: flip-flops.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a light sandal with a thong that passes between the big and second toes. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: one-piece.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an article of clothing made or consisting of a single piece.

lexUnit.name: two-piece.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a two-piece suit. [Clothing]

lexUnit.name: flannels.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: men's trousers made of woollen flannel.

lexUnit.name: rags.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: rags old or tattered clothes.

lexUnit.name: silks.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: garments made from silk, especially as worn by a jockey in the colours of a particular horse owner.

lexUnit.name: satins.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: garments made out of satin.

lexUnit.name: cottons.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: garments made of cotton.

lexUnit.name: tweeds.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: clothes made of tweed.

lexUnit.name: ermines.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: garments made of ermine

lexUnit.name: muslins.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: garments made of ermine.

lexUnit.name: tippet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's fur cape or woollen shawl

lexUnit.name: doublet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a man's short close-fitting padded jacket, commonly worn from the 14th to the 17th century

lexUnit.name: tatters.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: garments that are extensively torn.

lexUnit.name: neckerchief.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a square of cloth worn round the neck.

lexUnit.name: breeches.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: short trousers fastened just below the knee, now chiefly worn for riding or as part of ceremonial dress

lexUnit.name: sweatshirt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loose sweater, typically of knitted cotton, worn for exercise or leisure.

lexUnit.name: sweatpants.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: loose trousers with an elasticated or drawstring waist, worn for exercise or leisure.

lexUnit.name: tracksuit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loose, warm outfit consisting of a sweatshirt and trousers, worn when exercising or as casual wear.

lexUnit.name: alb.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a white vestment reaching to the feet, worn by clergy and servers in some Christian Churches.

lexUnit.name: stole.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long scarf or shawl, generally worn by women, loosely over the shoulders.

lexUnit.name: chasuble.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an ornate sleeveless outer vestment worn by a priest when celebrating Mass.

lexUnit.name: cope.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long, loose cloak worn by a priest or bishop on ceremonial occasions. [Eccl]

lexUnit.name: buskin.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: historical a calf-high or knee-high boot.

lexUnit.name: pallium.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woollen vestment conferred by the Pope on an archbishop, consisting of a narrow circular band placed round the shoulders with a short lappet hanging from front and back

lexUnit.name: gauntlet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a stout glove with a long loose wrist

lexUnit.name: cravat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a short, wide strip of fabric worn by men round the neck and tucked inside an open-necked shirt.

lexUnit.name: briefs.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: men's underwear

lexUnit.name: cossie.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a swimming costume or a pair of swimming trunks.
